news_header: New Murchison Gold released a feasibility study for the Crown Prince deposit, indicating a resource estimate of 2.205 million tonnes of gold.
news_original_title: New Murchison Releases Feasibility Study for Crown Prince Gold Deposit
news_text: New Murchison Gold (ASX:NMG) announced a feasibility study for the Crown Prince deposit at its Garden Gully project in Western Australia, revealing a resource estimate of 2.205 million tonnes at 3.9 grams per tonne, equating to 279,000 ounces of gold. The study forecasts an undiscounted pre-tax cash flow of AU$226 million over 30 months at the current gold price. Capital required to start production is AU$5.4 million. CEO Alex Passmore highlighted the project's potential for early cash flows, especially from the Southeast Zone. Mining approvals were submitted in late 2024, with operations expected to start in June and first ore sales in August.
